_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1. Facility accidental release and emergency response policy.

The management and employees of Stephenson Service Company are committed to the prevention of any

accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia or propane. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is

prepared to work with the Winslow fire department, Stephenson County LEPC or other authorities, to

mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2. The stationary source and the regulated substances handled.

The primary activity at the facility, which is located at 9253 W. Nora Rd, Winslow, IL 61089, is the storage

of fertilizers for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct

application as a crop production nutrient. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct

application as a crop production nutrient. The storage and handling system consists of two 45,000 gallon

storage tank, loading risers, associated plumbing and nurse tanks. Access to the site is restricted to

authorized facility employees, authorized management personnel and authorized contractors.

The maximum quantity of anhydrous ammonia that can be stored would be 460,000 pounds, this includes

the amount of anhydrous ammonia that could be stored in nurse tanks..

3. The worst-case release scenario and the alternate release scenario.

This facility has developed a worst-case and alternative-case scenario, however, since this is security-sensitive

information it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as required by EPA regulations.

4. The accidental release prevention program.

This facility complies with EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Rule and with all applicable state codes and

regulations. This facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and

Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc. as

adopted by

state regulation and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration

(OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia". The propane facility was designed

and constructed in accordance with NFPA-58. Compliance with these regulations and on-going training of our

employees make up our accident release prevention program.

5. Five year accident history.

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia or propane in the past five years that:

- have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor

- to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, shelter in place, property damage,

or environmental damage.

6. The emergency response program.

The facility has:

- a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;

- provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as

required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);

- a written emergency response plan, in accordance with OSHA standard, 29 CFR 1910.120, including preemergency

planning and employee training.

In the event of an emergency involving anhydrous ammonia, it is our policy to notify the Winslow Fire

Department and Stephenson County LEPC and request that they respond to the emergency. Our emergency

action plans have been coordinated with both the fire department and LEPC.

7. Planned changes to improve safety.

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the

maintenance of safe conditions. There are no specific safety recommendations for implementation at this

time.
